description: {"blocks":[{"key":"9e6gf","text":"Detection of Cryptosporidium parvum and/or Cryptosporidium hominis from fecal samples by qPCR.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it’s working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6i2il","text":"Combine the following for a single qPCR sample (9μl  per sample). Scale accordingly for number of samples and technical replicates:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"drf32","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f2j38","text":"5 μl           10 x Luna Universal Probe qPCR Master Mix","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2tdag","text":"0.25 μl      10 μM Forward Primer (ATGACGGGTAACGGGGAAT)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7tndr","text":"0.25 μl      10 μM Reverse Primer (CCAATTACAAAACCAAAAAGTCC)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"80ove","text":"1μl             1 μM Probe ([FAM]CGCGCCTGCTGCCTTCCTTAGATG[BHQ1])","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1vm9c","text":"2.5μl          Ultrapure water","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4hp52","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"64h1f","text":"Load mastermix in 96-well PCR plate using a multichannel pipette.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"et4rk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"850p5","text":"Add 1μl extracted DNA to corresponding wells.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b3b3s","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"alf6l","text":"Keep a detailed plate map of which wells contain standard curve DNA, sample DNA, positive control DNA, no DNA control.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fm5if","text":"Spin plate in a centrifuge at low speed to make sure the samples are at the bottom of the well.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"36gdk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6fujc","text":"Run qPCR cycling as described for Luna Universal qPCR Mixture. Make sure qPCR machine is measuring FAM at the correct cycle:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"58ibl","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2fjc3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8flah","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bg75l","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2r3t5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7a1k8","text":"Follow protocol from Quick-DNA Fecal/Soil Microbe Miniprep Kit from Zymo Research to extract total genomic DNA from stool sample (both standard curve samples and experimental samples).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7vn0j","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9t4nm","text":"Stool samples (0.1 g) should be thoroughly vortexed in lysis buffer and then subjected to five freeze-thaw cycles prior to DNA extraction.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d0ob","text":"To 100 mg of fecal material (known to not be infected with Cryptosporidium), spike in a known number of Cryptosporidium parvum. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3iasd","text":"Calculate delta Ct values for samples that contain the standard curve. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f86g3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1vahh","text":"Using Microsoft excel (or a similar graphing program) plot the delta Ct values on the Y-axis and the number of oocysts/g on the x-axis.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f5h93","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4o5bf","text":"Use the analysis tools to determine the linear equation of your standard curve samples.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cmbkb","text":"Use the equation determined from your standard control samples, you can estimate the number of oocysts/g in your experimental samples.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e8mea","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fvaml","text":"Y = delta Ct value for experimental sample","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9t294","text":"Solve for X = oocysts/g for your experimental sample","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Detection of Cryptosporidium in stool samples by Taq-Man qPCR
title_html: Detection of Cryptosporidium in stool samples by Taq-Man qPCR
